subject: Climate & Environment
title: Mining in the Forest
description: A 60-second lesson on Mining in the Forest.

hook.text: Gold mining in the Amazon uses mercury that poisons rivers for hundreds of kilometers.

buildup.text: Miners strip the forest, dig massive pits, and wash ore with toxic chemicals.

discovery.text: One gold ring generates about 20 tons of mine waste â€” most of it in former forest.

twist.text: Demand for cobalt, lithium, and rare earths for green technology threatens new forests.

climax.text: The metals in your phone may trace back to a cleared patch of rainforest.

punchline.text: Digging for treasure often buries an entire ecosystem.

quiz.question: What toxic substance is commonly used in Amazon gold mining?
